department.ch: 產業經濟研究所碩士班

goal.ch: This course introduces students to the strategic interactions of economic agents, such as consumers, firms, and regulators, with a focus on business applications and managerial decision-making process that enable students to understand, formulate, and solve games systematically. Some basic understanding of calculus and probability is expected.
goal.en: This course introduces students to the strategic interactions of economic agents, such as consumers, firms, and regulators, with a focus on business applications and managerial decision-making process that enable students to understand, formulate, and solve games systematically. Some basic understanding of calculus and probability is expected.

outline.ch: This course will cover the following content.1. Sequential move games2. Dominance solvable games3. Pure strategy Nash equilibrium4. Mixed strategy Nash equilibrium5. Subgame perfect Nash equilibrium6. Games of repeated interactions7. Bayesian Nash equilibrium8. Perfect Bayesian equilibrium9. Semi-separating equilibrium10. Intuitive and Divinity Criterion11. Signaling games12. Screening games13. Cheap talk games14. Evolutionary games
outline.en: This course will cover the following content.1. Sequential move games2. Dominance solvable games3. Pure strategy Nash equilibrium4. Mixed strategy Nash equilibrium5. Subgame perfect Nash equilibrium6. Games of repeated interactions7. Bayesian Nash equilibrium8. Perfect Bayesian equilibrium9. Semi-separating equilibrium10. Intuitive and Divinity Criterion11. Signaling games12. Screening games13. Cheap talk games14. Evolutionary games

textbook.ch: “Required (please go to Caves Books on campus to get an original copy):1. Watson, Joel (2013). Strategy – An Introduction to Game Theory, 3rd Edition. Singapore: World Scientific Publishing Company.2. Tadelis, Steven (2013). Game Theory: An Introduction. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press.Recommended (I will use some chapters from the following textbooks):3. Harrington, Joseph E. (2015). Games, Strategies and Decision Making, 2nd Edition. New York, NY: Worth Publishers.4. Dixit A., Skeath S., and Reiley D. (2015). Games of Strategy, 4th Edition. New York, NY: W.W. Norton and Company.藍兆杰、徐偉傑、陳怡君（譯）。策略的賽局。新北市：弘智文化。(Chinese version is also accepted as an alternative)Optional:5. Brandenburger A.M. and Nalebuff B.J. (2011). Co-Opetition. New York, NY: Penguin Random House. (if you are interested in business applications of game theory)許恩得（譯）。競合策略 。台北市：培生。6. 張振華 (2009)。賽局好好玩。台北市：博雅書屋。(a beginner’s guide to game theory)“
textbook.en: “Required (please go to Caves Books on campus to get an original copy):1. Watson, Joel (2013). Strategy – An Introduction to Game Theory, 3rd Edition. Singapore: World Scientific Publishing Company.2. Tadelis, Steven (2013). Game Theory: An Introduction. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press.Recommended (I will use some chapters from the following textbooks):3. Harrington, Joseph E. (2015). Games, Strategies and Decision Making, 2nd Edition. New York, NY: Worth Publishers.4. Dixit A., Skeath S., and Reiley D. (2015). Games of Strategy, 4th Edition. New York, NY: W.W. Norton and Company.藍兆杰、徐偉傑、陳怡君（譯）。策略的賽局。新北市：弘智文化。(Chinese version is also accepted as an alternative)Optional:5. Brandenburger A.M. and Nalebuff B.J. (2011). Co-Opetition. New York, NY: Penguin Random House. (if you are interested in business applications of game theory)許恩得（譯）。競合策略 。台北市：培生。6. 張振華 (2009)。賽局好好玩。台北市：博雅書屋。(a beginner’s guide to game theory)“

gradMethod.ch: Problem Sets (5％ each): 30％ Exams (20％ each): 60％ Class participation: 10％
gradMethod.en: Problem Sets (5％ each): 30％ Exams (20％ each): 60％ Class participation: 10％

officeHour.ch: Thursday, 9 to 11 am, or by appointment.
officeHour.en: Thursday, 9 to 11 am, or by appointment.

ch.competencies: 獨立思考和解決問題能力

ch: 學制:限學士班。年級:限三年級、四年級。
en: Type:Undergraduate Program only.Year:Third Year、Fourth Year only.
